alert.note: Alert for Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 6:16PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Gloucester, southeastern Montgomery, southwestern Philadelphia and eastern Delaware Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 616 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chester, or 12 miles west of Gloucester City, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Chester, Yeadon, Folcroft, Swarthmore, Paulsboro, Narberth, East Lansdowne, Darby Township, Morris Park, Bryn Mawr, Trout Lake, Radnor Township, Broomall, Newtown Square, Chester Township, Gibbstown, Drexel Hill, Tinicum Township and Nether Providence Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 3 and 12. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 336 and 338. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
